lines.text: If you'll marry, marry an orphan.
When will all this finally end?
Never. To begin with, what are you talking about?

Detochkin went against our holiest of holies, the Constitution. The Constitution guarantees citizens the right to private property. To a car. To a home. To a dacha. To money. Money, comrades, nobody outlawed money yet!
Everybody believes. Some believe that there is a God. Some believe that He doesn't exist.
Detochkin is, of course, guilty. But he isn't guilty.
And if you don't know, then be quiet
[speaking to a man who didn't say a word]

Dear Judges, maybe I acted wrong, but I was doing what my heart told me to, I just could not stand it, people steal, they steal a lot... I tried to help you, comrades judges... and that's why it all happened like it did... Let me go, please, it will never happen again, I swear, it will not...
You live only because you've got the power of attorney! Your car is registered to your wife's name, your summer house is in my name! You've got nothing yours! You're a rag-tag!

[to his daughter, who is crying at the trial of her husband for profiteering]
Don't cry. You'll find yourself another. An honest one!
Yes, dear viewer, Detochkin never took the money. While he is a thief, he is a selfless and honest person.
